programme.title: Joshua
programme.desc: Men who return home from the Civil War with hopes of rebuilding their lives find death and destruction.

programme.title: The Black Fox
programme.desc: Filmmaker Louis Clyde Stoumen uses Goethe's version of "Reynard the Fox" and other materials to create an allegorical portrait of Adolf Hitler's rise to power.

programme.title: Black Fox: The Price of Peace
programme.desc: In 1860s Texas, a man whose abused wife fell in love with a Kiowa organizes a hunting party to recapture her.

programme.title: Springtime In Texas
programme.desc: Pete Grant controls the town of Pecos and it's Mayor and Marshal. When Jimmy, Denny, and Lasses arrive they soon find themselves in trouble.

programme.title: Frontier Feud
programme.desc: An unruly band of claim-jumpers causes some hot and heavy disputes.

programme.title: The Man From Utah
programme.desc: A tough cowboy has a head-to-head confrontation with a gang of outlaws using a rodeo as its base of operations.

programme.title: Randy Rides Alone
programme.desc: Government agent Randy Bowers (John Wayne) is accused of shooting up a saloon and has to escape from the jail to find the man behind the murders.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Adam is taken hostage by a band of U.S. Army prisoners who have escaped and sought refuge on the Ponderosa.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A wanderer seeking his parents' lynchers, arrives in Virginia City as Ben and Adam are convicted of murder.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: Captain Rynning struggles to find enough men to capture a gang of escaped convicts after they escape from prison.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: When Clint Travis is falsely accused of a murder, Rynning sends him into Galioro Mountains to prove his innocence by finding the cattle rustlers who actually committed the crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Rube Burrows becomes infamous through the south for train robbery but his girlfriend is portrayed as the brains; Margaret ingratiates herself with the outlaws leading to a deadly showdown.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A former deputy and his gang terrorize a town with the help of a corrupt sheriff.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim persuades an imperious plantation owner to allow a squatter and his pregnant wife to remain on her land.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is amused when his friend is mistaken for the missing son of King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim takes a turn as a volunteer deputy to guard a prisoner, but he begins to doubt the prisoner's guilt.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim believes a fur company may be trying to drive him away by killing any Cajun trapper with whom he does business.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity leads an angry farmer to decide that Jim must marry his daughter in a shotgun wedding.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim is asked to protect a group of travelers from a bandit preying on people along the road to Natchez.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim's family takes on the local saloonkeeper, who has different visions of the town's future.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim assists farmers who are being forced to pay protection money to an old woman who threatens to unleash the ghost of a Louisiana pirate on them.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: President Jackson asks Jim's friend to prevent a group of planters from seceding from the union.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: While traveling along the Mississippi, Jim is bushwhacked by settlers who accuse him of being a land-grabber.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: While traveling to New Orleans, Jim encounters two women from a school, searching for one of their students, who is planning to elope.

programme.title: The Adventures of Jim Bowie
programme.desc: Jim learns that a slave he had freed has been recaptured and is about to be sold at a slave auction.

programme.title: Saddle Serenade
programme.desc: During an ambush that has been staged for the amusement of new arrivals to the Vista Grande dude ranch, Tom Logan, a U.S. Marshal posing as one of the ranch's cowhands, is shot and killed by an unseen assailant.

programme.title: Gun Smoke
programme.desc: U.S. marshals trail crooks seeking buried Indian treasure at an archaeological site.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: A Quaker (Gail Russell) and her family reform a wounded outlaw (John Wayne) who has a killer on his trail.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: Slade is hired as a bodyguard to protect a singer whose life has been threatened.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: A woman hires a vicious killer to murder her fiancee.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: Slade is transporting an embezzler when train robbers release his prisoner.

programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: A rancher whose foreman is murdered asks Slade for help.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A crook is mistakenly given cash designated for the construction of a clinic.
